settings.html:
Barco Coronis Fusion MDCC-6230 is a high-quality general radiology diagnostic PACS display optimized for grayscale and color imaging. It efficiently integrates images from multiple modalities, such as CR, CT, MR, cath, and echocardiogram, making it an ideal choice for radiologists seeking top-notch image quality, increased productivity, and enhanced workflow flexibility.

Featuring a 30-inch LCD screen, the MDCC-6230 offers the flexibility to operate as a single 6MP (3,280 x 2,048 pixels) display or split into two seamless 3MP displays (1536 x 2048 pixels each). This user-friendly design allows radiologists to organize and interpret images side by side without a center bezel or visual distractions.

A great feature of MDCC-6230 is its power-efficient LED backlight. LED backlights consume less power, are high in brightness, and produce significantly less heat, thus greatly increasing the monitor's lifespan. In addition, MDCC-6230 is equipped with a built-in I-Guard photometer front sensor for automatic DICOM calibration and quality assurance (QA) tests, simplifying routine checks and ensuring consistently high-quality imaging.

Equip your workspace with the Barco Coronis Fusion MDCC-6230 and experience an enhanced workflow that aligns with the evolving needs of radiologists looking for a modern, high-quality diagnostic display for teleradiology.

settings.title: Greyscale DICOM Calibration with Barco's I-Guard Technology
settings.content: The Barco Coronis Fusion MDCC-6230 display proudly features Barco's innovative I-Guard technology. This integral component employs a front-of-screen photometer, persistently monitoring image quality and maintaining accurate DICOM calibration. Seamlessly integrated with Barco's MediCal QAWeb service, I-Guard offers radiologists a holistic solution for quality assurance, simplifying calibration management. I-Guard's smart monitoring capabilities adapt to the distinctive needs of radiology, establishing itself as an essential asset for radiologists aiming to boost diagnostic certainty and improve patient care.

settings.title: Uniform Luminance Technology
settings.content: Addressing the inherent challenges faced by radiologists, the Barco Coronis Fusion MDCC-6230 incorporates Barco's Uniform Luminance Technology (ULT). Traditional LCD displays commonly suffer from uneven brightness, affecting over 25% of the screen area, leading to image disturbance and compromised quality. In contrast, ULT technology eradicates these inconsistencies in color and luminance, ensuring complete adherence to DICOM GSDF standards across the entirety of the screen area. This advanced feature not only enhances image precision but also boosts the overall quality, providing radiologists with the reliable tools they need for meticulous diagnostics.

settings.title: Single View & Display Partitioner
settings.content: The Barco Coronis Fusion MDCC-6230 integrates Barco's User-friendly Workflow Tools that offer advanced functionalities such as SingleView and Display Partitioner. SingleView permits you to connect your dual-input display and use it as a seamless desktop without any disruptions at the screen's center. This eliminates the need for an extra monitor and creates a more versatile desktop, enabling you to place images at the center without any distortion risks. On the other hand, Display Partitioner enables you to split a single input source into two sections on your screen, proving immensely beneficial for multitasking or contrasting different images side by side. Both SingleView and Display Partitioner are designed to enhance your workflow and boost productivity, providing you with increased control over your display layout.

settings.title: Unleashing Precision: The Power of 30-Bit Color in Medical Imaging
settings.content:
The introduction of 30-bit color in medical imaging marks a significant leap in precision and detail. By unlocking a vast spectrum of over a billion colors, it offers radiologists an unprecedented level of image detail, far surpassing what was achievable with the standard 24-bit color depth. This considerable enhancement in color range is critical to the accuracy of diagnoses, assisting radiologists in identifying subtle irregularities that may have previously gone unnoticed.

The benefits of 30-bit color depth in medical imaging extend beyond the delivery of more vibrant images. Its inherent potential lies in improving diagnostic accuracy and operational efficiency. The advanced color depth minimizes grayscale banding, allowing for the visualization of the minutest image details. As such, 30-bit color depth plays a crucial role in facilitating the detection of anomalies. Its transformative impact on medical imaging signifies a new phase of enhanced clarity and reliability in diagnostic medicine.

settings.title: Ambient Light Compensation (ALC)
settings.content: MDCC-6230 comes equipped with Barco's Ambient Light Compensation (ALC) technology, designed to ensure unwavering DICOM compliance under all lighting conditions. This innovative feature measures the display brightness against the surrounding ambient light. Working in tandem with MediCal QAWeb, it notifies users when the ambient light exceeds a predefined threshold. This intelligent feature guarantees impeccable image quality, enabling you to discern crucial details regardless of your workspace lighting conditions. The ALC feature empowers you with the ability to maintain consistent DICOM compliance and exceptional image quality in varying environments.

settings.title: SpotView™
settings.content: Coronis MDCC-6230 features the innovative SpotView tool, designed to momentarily boost display brightness within a specified circular area of interest, promoting a detailed inspection of intricate elements. This dynamic feature adjusts contrast on-the-fly and, based on user preference, can either magnify or invert pixels within the SpotView region. Such capabilities offer a significantly optimized viewing experience, facilitating the detection of subtle details with enhanced precision and clarity.

settings.title: DimView
settings.content: Incorporated in the Barco Coronis Fusion MDCC-6230, the DimView feature smartly lowers the brightness of auxiliary displays used for tasks like patient worklists or dictation. This helps reduce peripheral light during readings, enabling your eyes to focus solely on the main diagnostic screen. You're given the flexibility to select which display(s) should automatically dim when the cursor is not active on them. DimView allows for individual control of each display's dimming, while DimView Link synchronizes dimming for all secondary displays, offering a tailored viewing experience customized to your specific needs. This advanced feature brings together convenience, adaptability, and a heightened focus for an optimal diagnostic workflow.

settings.title: Experience Ergonomic Flexibility With Solid Alloy Stand
settings.content:
The stability and reliability of a display stand is paramount in maintaining a consistent and comfortable viewing experience. Dealing with a wobbly stand can be distracting and troublesome, causing unnecessary interruptions to workflow. Minor adjustments can lead to unevenness, leaving one side of the monitor lower than the other, and resulting in a constant need for readjustments - a frustration no professional wants to deal with. However, with the solid alloy stand of the Barco Coronis Fusion MDCC-6230, these issues become a thing of the past. Designed with precision and durability, the robust alloy stand guarantees stability, eliminating wobble and maintaining a balanced viewing plane even after adjustments.
MDCC-6230's all-alloy stand allows for tilt, swivel, and height adjustment, ensuring the monitor aligns perfectly with your preferred viewing angle. In addition, the stand includes a connector compartment cover for efficient cable management, contributing to a tidy and organized workspace. Experience a hassle-free, seamless workflow with the superior stability of the Coronis Fusion MDCC-6230's all-alloy stand.

settings.title: Barco QAWeb Calibration & QA Software
settings.content: In alignment with the high standards of all Barco's medical display systems, the MDCC-6230 incorporates the beneficial feature of MediCal QAWeb. This can be accessed either as a standalone installation on a local workstation or as a cloud-based subscription service, designed for automated calibration and Quality Assurance. Consequently, this ensures maximum uptime for the display, eliminating the need for manual intervention. By leveraging this state-of-the-art technology, users can enjoy uninterrupted operation and consistent top-tier performance, resulting in a more efficient and reliable workflow.

settings.title: MDCC-6230 & MXRT: Unrivaled Diagnostic Precision
settings.content: Optimize your reading experience by pairing The Barco® Coronis Fusion MDCC-6230 with a Barco MXRT graphics card. This powerful combination delivers exceptional image quality and performance, ensuring accurate and efficient diagnostic capabilities for radiologists. The MXRT-5600, MXRT-6700, MXRT-7600 and MXRT-8700 graphics card are specifically designed to enhance the capabilities of the MDCC-6230, providing seamless integration and the highest possible image quality in the medical imaging field. Experience unparalleled clarity and precision in your diagnostic workflow by choosing the Barco® Coronis Fusion MDCC-6230 and MXRT graphics card bundle.

settings.title: Barco Anti Reflective Optical Glass
settings.content: The Barco MDCC-6230 display comes fitted with a protective glass featuring an anti-reflective coating, offering a significant boost in both performance and visual clarity for radiologists. This cutting-edge coating technology effectively reduces glare and reflections, empowering medical professionals to observe images with unparalleled sharpness and precision. The reduction in visual distractions brought about by the anti-reflective coating allows radiologists to concentrate on critical details, facilitating more accurate diagnoses and thereby improving patient outcomes. With the Barco MDCC-6230 and its innovative anti-reflective protective glass, experience a level of image clarity that is truly second to none.

settings.title: MDCC-6230: Balanced Weight & Dimensions
settings.content: Designed to deliver stability and durability, the Barco MDCC-6230 display sports dimensions of 730mm (28.7 inches) width, adjustable height between 580mm and 675mm (22.8 to 26.5 inches) with the stand, and 261mm (10.2 inches) in depth. Weighing 20.5kg (45.2 lbs), its robust build and stable stand offer a reliable workspace for radiologists. The enduring construction of the MDCC-6230 ensures a long-lasting medical imaging solution that can withstand demanding work environments. The solidity of its design not only enhances its lifespan but also bolsters trust in the precision and consistency of the diagnostic images it presents.

settings.title: SmoothGray™ for the best DICOM precision
settings.content: The Barco MDCC-6230 employs an innovative technology called SmoothGray, designed to deliver unmatched DICOM accuracy. This exclusive technology elevates grayscale refinement to a superior level, augmenting the discernibility of delicate details within medical images. SmoothGray accomplishes this by creating an extremely smooth range of grayscales, which assists radiologists in distinguishing nuanced differences in gray shades, a factor critical for meticulous diagnosis and treatment planning. Consequently, the MDCC-6230 distinguishes itself with its extraordinary image quality and precision, setting new standards in medical imaging.

settings.title: SmartCursor: Effortless Cursor Movement Across Varied Displays for Radiologists
settings.content: Have you encountered the exasperating problem of your cursor getting stuck on the borders of differently-sized displays? Barco has developed a clever solution to this issue: SmartCursor™. This handy feature prevents the cursor from getting trapped on the edges of adjacent displays that vary in size, enabling fluid navigation across screens. To activate SmartCursor™, simply go to the Barco System Settings and select the SmartCursor™ option. With this feature enabled, you can benefit from smooth and uninterrupted cursor movement across all your radiology workstation displays, enhancing workflow efficiency and reducing disturbances during crucial diagnostic activities.

settings.title: Application Appearance Manager (AAM)
settings.content: For those who frequently use diagnostic displays for non-diagnostic tasks like reading text documents or emails, the high luminance levels of these screens can often cause eye strain. Barco offers a solution to this problem in the form of the Application Appearance Manager (AAM). This feature allows users to assign specific application windows to a lower luminance or alternative color profile, while keeping the full diagnostic luminance for applications that demand it. The result is an improvement in visual comfort and a reduction in eye strain without compromising the required brightness levels for diagnostic tasks. AAM offers a customizable solution that enhances the overall functionality and adaptability of the diagnostic display, tailored to the user's needs.

settings.title: Multi-Sensor Technology (I-MST) on Barco MDCC-6230
settings.content:
The Barco Coronis Fusion MDCC-6230 employs Intelligent Multi-Sensor Technology (I-MST), which consistently optimizes image quality while maintaining performance longevity:
The Uniform Luminance technology, in harmony with a smart backlight design, ensures balanced light distribution across the screen. This effectively eliminates dim spots that could lead to overlooked abnormalities, maintaining flawless image integrity.
In addition, the MDCC-6230 features twin heat sensors situated at the right and left sides on the back of the monitor. These sensors continuously relay data to the central processing unit, optimizing heat dissipation and ensuring efficient thermal management. This feature helps to prevent excess heat from damaging internal components, thus directly enhancing the monitor's image quality and longevity.
The MDCC-6230 employs Barco's patented Ambient Light Compensation (ALC) and I-Guard technologies to account for fluctuating lighting conditions around workstations. These technologies, integrated within a front-of-screen sensor, continuously monitor lighting changes and adjust both monitor brightness and the grayscale and color values in the image to meet DICOM standards. This ensures steadfast image quality and consistency, regardless of external lighting conditions.

settings.title: Input/Output Ports
settings.content: The Barco Coronis MDCC-6230 is engineered to maximize efficiency and versatility, equipped with a diverse array of I/O ports to ensure smooth and flexible connectivity. With both DisplayPort and DVI interfaces, it assures compatibility with a wide variety of systems and devices, enhancing user experience by enabling easy integration into numerous setups. In addition to this, the MDCC-6230 features a built-in USB hub, further expanding its connectivity options for peripheral devices and augmenting its user-centric design. The MDCC-6230 display can be seamlessly paired with any graphics card or operating system. The model represents a significant improvement over its predecessor, the 6130, by consuming 31% less power and generating considerably less heat, thanks to the innovative LED backlight technology.
